Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Tygargabo
Reviews.Content: Great accomodations, great view, great time! We spent 3 short nights in a 3-bedroom villa (R2) and it was everything we could hope for. With the exception of an intensely windy first day where we really could not snorkel, this stay was better than any other in recent memory. This is a fantastic choice for anyone looking for a place to relax and enjoy a quiet vacation in PR. Cooking for our family of 5 was easy, with a grocery store a short drive away. There are a couple of restaurants walking distance, along with horseback riding even closer (we went to all 3). The staff was friendly and helpful - even for us short-notice vacationers. There was wi-fi for my ipad addicted sons - but even they could not resist the snorkeling in Blue Hole and reading on the deck, overlooking the beach. Our unit was very clean and everything was new. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: KDUNNE
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights with my husband and 10 year old son in April. Stayed in Villa Bajandas B2, and we've already booked for 8 nights in March 2013. Clean and simply accommodations with a view to die for: aqua/turquoise/sea green waters in the reef with navy in the blue hole. The hotel rents out snorkeling equipment and my boys fell in love with exploring the reef. I loved investigating the tidal pools along the reef that touched the beach. We saw wild iguanas in the trees and on the beach. Friendly and helpful hosts. Go (but stay off the reef)!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach & snorkeling - couch & other things could be better”
Reviews.Author: paho312
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to PR, first 2 nights @ VT in M1. Magnificent views of the beach and great to listen to the surf hit the beach just feet away, but M1 is in need of some improvements: large couch needs to be replaced, extremely uncomfortable to sit on as a large piece of plywood is supposed to remove the sag under the cushions - it makes it worse; one of the bathroom lights is rusted, the window shades for the front doors need replacing (several panels have fallen out), and the mattress is as hard as a rock; worse yet is the hammock on the porch - it was so loaded with mold that I wouldn't even touch it. I would definitely come back to Shacks beach but would look for another apartment to stay in. The restaurant just a short walk down the beach to the west Eclipse) was worth going.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Janet A
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at Villa Tropical for 7 nights at the end of March. We had a wonderful time. The apartment was great - clean and convenient and well appointed - looking out on beautiful Shack's Beach. This is positively one of the most beautiful patio views we have ever had. This is an amazing value for beach front accommodations. Trevor and Jennifer, who own Villa Tropical, were most helpful. They set us up with contacts for surfing, with snorkel equipment, and with all the info we needed to navigate around the west coast of Puerto Rico. We would highly recommend Villa Tropical and hope we will be able to get back there for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: robinsrq
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing place to stay! Right on the beach with great snorkeling. The owners were fantastic! Thank you for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient to Beach”
Reviews.Author: DreLane
Reviews.Content: The location of these villas can't be beat- just steps from Shacks Beach. We stayed in Q3- well worth the money. This room was awesome...gorgeous view, nice and modern, great deck with seating and a hammock. We rented snorkelling equipment from the front office- definitely worth it because the snorkelling turned out to be AWESOME. We saw a lot at low-tide, and Trevor was very helpful with the equipment. I guess our only complaint was that there was no place to get breakfast unless you drive there (although there is a kitchen so you could stock up on groceries). There are two restaurants within walking distance- but you should bring a flashlight. Ola Lola's, a bar/restaurant (get the peanut butter burger...trust me!) and The Montana....delicious but pretty upscale. Oh, and the sheets were kind of hard and scratchy so they hurt our sunburn....I recommend bringing comfortable sleeping clothes. But overall a really nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Experience”
Reviews.Author: patrick g
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an exclusive, relaxing, beautiful part of paradise, try Villa Tropical,. Hosts Trevor & Jennifer go out of their way to make you really comfortable. The local beaches and restaurants, especially Ocean Front, compliment the experience. We stayed in Q2.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, questionable service.”
Reviews.Author: holenearth
Reviews.Content: We came in with a large group. The apartments are in different bunches. They did nothing to help us all get rooms close together. This really did matter since we are all very close friends. I feel that we were more of an incontinence than anyrhing. At that price they should at least consider our requests.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Slice of Heaven !”
Reviews.Author: Mary R
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in Feb & absolutely loved every moment!!! It was exactly if not even better than we had expected. We stayed in F1 which is a gorgeous & comfortable apt. It was myself, husband & 3 teenage boys and where on a mission to surf & relax. Everyone enjoyed taking the time to snorkel & walks on the beach & around the neighborhood especially to Ola Lola's.(.A must along with their infamous peanut butter burger. Great host & staff there too!!) Each morning we enjoy our coffee on the porch & would receive our daily surf report from Mike & guide us to our destination. If you want to know where the surf is he is the man!!! Him & Val are awesome host in their beautiful villa. Trevor & staff are extremely helpful & accommodated with any request needed..if your coming from the states bring a pack of American Spirits Cigs for Trevor..he will greatly appreciate the gesture !! The view is breathtaking, we felt very safe & slept each night like a baby. We had 3 different neighbors during our week stay. They all were considerate, pleasant & professionals that were really happy to be at the VT. In regards to a few previous posts I have read I would like to comment on: If you are in need of any cleaning supplies just ask the main office. They were very accommodating in going into their closet & provide us with any of the essentials to keep our unit clean during the week stay. I can totally understand why they would not keep certain cleaning products left in the units as a liability point and since they do cater to families accidents happen especially with small children. Secondly, noise from planes. We were disappointed in hoping to see more military planes!!! We only saw one USAF cargo plane doing some maneuvers once & that plane was not noisy at all. You will see the occasional USCG helicopter flying around but that only sounds like a leaf blower. We enjoyed watching any military plane fly by because we know they are out doing their job or training for that next mission and in PR the USCG is kept very busy!!! Commercial flights are a bit noisy since they do happen in the odd hours but I enjoyed listening to them cause it brought me back to the moment we were going to be landing & the excitement we felt about beginning our vacation. And then I would feel bad for all those who were leaving & wonder if they had a great vacation & felt as sad as we would when we had to leave. Overall, we were very happy we choose the VT for our family time together. It was perfect setting for spending time with each other. Definitely did not want that resort atmosphere just a safe, clean, comfortable place to call home for a week & we got it here!! Thanks VT see you all again one day. Also, if you follow their directions exactly it is easy to get there even in the middle of the night & only took us less than 10 mins to arrive!!!! If you are planning on doing surfing or discovering the island..excellent location!!! we ventured to Old San Juan and into Rincon all within a very reasonable time..Kids hit every surf spot they watched on youtube or read about in the magazine. A lifetime of memories

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: LaDonna75
Reviews.Content: We are not city people and wanted a more secluded place to stay and relax. Villa Tropical gave us just that. What a wonderful view right out our front door. Huge deck and just steps to the beach. We hated to leave and would go back in an instant. Trevor was very helpful in giving suggestions of where to dine and visit. We had an awsome vacation in Isabela.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected, nice people”
Reviews.Author: Gregg M
Reviews.Content: The website was pretty dead on about what I was getting. They provided the right amenities, and the price was great. Walk out onto the deck and look at the ocean? Yup. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach location, poorly equipped”
Reviews.Author: mxalpert
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a one-bedroom condo right on the beach. The condo was nice enough, the beach area was lovely, and the sound of the water lapping all night long was wonderful. It seems that most of the friendly people we met come there for long stays year after year. Those people probably don't mind that the condo had almost nothing to make our 2 night stay easier. If I made a list of what it didn't have, it would take pages. It is easier to say, there was a small bar of soap, one washcloth, and watered down dish detergent. For someone staying a long time, they might not resent that there wasn't even a coffee filter or broom, but for 2 nights, we just ended up buying enough for breakfast and eating out the rest of the time. Having stayed in dozens of condo rentals, I have never seen any place as bereft of the basics, such as a tea bag or some coffee or kitchen cleanser. We know that people leave things so that there should be no need for someone to buy everything needed to make a meal or keep the place tidy. I wondered what they could have done with all of the things that people must have left, and then I saw the closet used by the cleaning staff. There were enough cleansers to open a small store. I understand health safety issues, I don't understand taking every single usable item from the condo. We stayed in M2 and my understanding was that there was a queen bed. I would call our bed a not very comfortable double.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, secluded, paradise...”
Reviews.Author: Gugui G
Reviews.Content: There is no other place in PR like this one. We live in the city and only went for the weekend to unwind a bit from everything and it was the best decision. The beach was spectacular; the room was impeccable and cozy. We are already planning to go back for a whole week. There is no way you donâ€™t fall in love with this place. Plus, the service, awesome. They really go the extra mile to satisfy their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with VT”
Reviews.Author: mkayhunt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very happy staying at the Villa Tropical. We are fairly picky about our accommodations and left pleased. We happen to stay in two units while on our week stay in PR due to availability issues. I will share the pros and cons from our perspective. 1) Ocean Blue Bldg. Rear unit with private pool. There was a sense of tranquility in this unit. It is modern and is relatively new construction. There was plenty of room and the unit was clean. It was very quite with adequate off street parking. These are rental units and there was some minor wear and tear. The living room furniture was fresh and there was a nice sized TV. We were there in January and the pool was too cold to use but nice to sit by. There is an outdoor shower for rinsing off after being at the beach. This unit is across the very narrow lane from the beach. The building is surrounded by other buildings but due to the foliage, you don't get that feeling. One thing that I did not like were the door locks. If you keep your doors to the main exit and patio locked, you had to use your key to unlock the door to exit the unit. This is solved by just keeping the key in the door at all times but not convenient when using both doors. I would return to this unit again. 2) Villa Quionnes unit Q3. This unit was completely different from Ocean Blue. It is right on the beach with spectacular views. It is older and needs a good paint job on the interior walls. The kitchen had bearly enough plates and bowls for two people. The mattress is in serious need of replacement. I had to sleep in the twin because the sag of the mattress made it uncomfortable for two people to sleep in the one double bed. Nevertheless, the place was amazing. It has a large shared deck with a hammock and picnic table for each unit. You immediately become in awe of the views and both my husband and I would find ourselves standing out on the deck just staring at the water. The noise of the waves is constant and loud. We really enjoyed watching the kite boarders. There is a hedge and gate between the buildings and the beach so there is a nice sense of separation from public on the beach. The views and proximity to the water outweighed the negatives stated above. I recommend renting a smaller car when staying at this unit. The parking spots won't accommodate SUVs.or large cars easily. This unit is part of a two building mini complex (M & Q buildings). There was a friendly sense of community where there was always a friendly face and plenty of people happy to answer questions. There are picnic tables between the two building and two outdoor showers to rinse off after being at the beach. I would return to this unit. 3) Villa Tropical as a whole. I liked it. I felt a sense of community among strangers with Trevor and Jennifer as the centerpieces. We had all of the privacy we wanted but there was always someone around if you needed anything. Even the cleaning ladies are really nice. The airplane noise is an issue. The first time a plane flew overhead it was in the middle of the night. It woke me from a deep sleep and scared the heck out of me. I got used to it by the end of the trip. It never bothered my husband. The beaches are nice but not good for swimming. The currents in January were very strong. Swimmers must also take care around the reefs which are numerous. The beach sand is clean. The kite boarders are fun to watch and are all over the beach in one section. They are very friendly and polite. The water temp was just fine for swimming. We are New Englanders. While we were there, we lost power for about a half day. The weather was not too hot so other than not having lights this was not too much of a problem. This is typical for this part of PR. I learned that some units have backup generators and some don't. I suggest taking that into account in the peak of summer when choosing a unit. There are plenty of restaurants near by and two that are within walking distance that I know of. I hope this helps. MK

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent beachfront location in a less traveled and charming corner of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: rickdhmd
Reviews.Content: The Villa Tropical is directly on a beautiful stretch of the Atlantic coastline close to the northwest corner of PR. The combination of shade (the sun faces the opposite side of the island)and steady trade winds makes for a comfortable, refreshing climate. The Villa Tropicale consists of a number of apartments dispersed in several beachfront houses. We stayed in R1 which has a large wrap around deck facing the ocean. We loved it but would note that some travelers might prefer a more luxurious, more expensive unit, of which there are several.our hosts Jennifer and Trevor were delightful and attentive as was the staff. The locale, near Isabela, has much to offer and the people are extremely friendly. There were many kite boarders surfing the waves--a source of constant entertainment. Highly recommended for lovers of the land and sea.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: torobuque
Reviews.Content: Incredible view and what a show. Kite boarders and surfers were riding fabulous waves. When it became calmer, paddle boarders and wind surfers joined the fun. Great decks. Fantastic walking beach with few people. Staff was terrific. Only down side were the commercial and military planes. Take off and landings are over the properties and even the sound of the waves (loud and wonderful) do not cover the noise of the early morning and late evening flights. Wireless Internet was not available in some of the units but was usually available at the office.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Tropical is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Jay C
Reviews.Content: Trevor and Jennifer are the best, will go out of there way to help in any way!!! And, best view at the point of "Shack's"... Thanks for taking care of us! Jay Crawford - www.outerbankskiting.com

Reviews.Title: “Villa Tropical -The BEST”
Reviews.Author: karen8858
Reviews.Content: Trevor, Jennifer and staff saved our vacation! Villa Tropical owners Trevor and Jennifer really do care about their guest experience, comfort and guest service is a top priority at Villa Tropical. We thought we were saving a bit and rented from another place at Shacks-site unseen. Big mistake-Big letdown....lets just say it was not for us.......Villa Tropical owners Trevor and Jennifer along with Cookie and their staff bent over backwards to accomodate us last minute. We moved a few times to different apartments and houses all excellent with each having its own charm. The top right apartment has been remodeled and updated recently and can not be beat for the Shacks experience! Renting from Villa Tropical you have many options to chose from for your vacation rental and you will love it. All rentals are clean, neat and with amenities travellers need and want. Shacks Beach and Villa Tropical, a small piece of heaven here in Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: Luisound
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the 1 bedroom apt's with the kitchen and during veterans day weekend in 2011 and really enjoyed it. Having the beach just steps away from you and hearing the waves at night was great. We live on the other side of the island and enjoy getaways like this. Although you have to share the back terrace area it was no biggie. we shared the grill neigbors were quiet just like us. The apartment a/c unit in the bedroom was kinda loud but we hit the bed so tired that we wouldn't notice the noise till the morning. Aside from that my wife, daughter and I plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: lizardbreath122
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November, 2010 so I'm a little late with my review. I traveled to Isabela during the low season so with Weather not being all that great we spent a good deal of time in the apartment we rented for the week at Villa Tropical. As there weren't many tourists around the owner bumped us up from the studio to a 1 bedroom, 1st floor apartment. Wow, was it nice! It had all of the amenities of my current apartment and felt like a home away from home. Being steps away from the beach isn't too bad either! Also across the way was the horse stable which always has a a few trips daily. It's a short 5 min drive to town and all of the other beaches. So this place has everything you need as far as convenience. Only negative thing is that it's set back away from the main road and somewhat difficult to find if you've never been there before. During the rainy season the road gets flooded and a few time I was a bit nervous about whether of not our little Yaris would make it through! All in all- definitely worth a stay. Isabela is beautiful and the beaches are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely spot!”
Reviews.Author: Ricky05
Reviews.Content: We spent four night in one of Villa Tropical's apartments. Our stay was excellent- incredible service, gorgeous beach, nice clean apt with small pool- a great stay. Again, we must stress the quality of yje service- every request was dealt with immediately. We will most definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor reveiwers were right on!”
Reviews.Author: TravelDevo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Tropical based on individual reviews and the number 1 rating through TripAdvisor for Isabela. We would definitely stay here again and agree with the reviews we found on TripAdvisor. Our baby was only 6 months younger than Jennifer and Trevor's youngest and we related to their retirement plan to Puerto Rico. We were also looking for possible retirement for ourselves to a tropical environment and found ourselves here to start our search. We loved this place and it was true to the reviews we read. If you are looking for more detail, read on. Villa Tropical is what it says, an apartment without everyday cleaning unless you request it. This is what we wanted, to be left alone and have our full kitchen etc. and to take care of ourselves. We absolutely loved our stay and look forward to staying there again. There are plenty of things to see that are only a day trip away including Rincon beach (known as a surfing mecca) with great picturesque views. Also, the wind caves and many other places we didn't have time to see. Staying at Villa Tropical and not going anywhere else is a vacation in itself. The grocery store is not far and you can sit on the deck and watch the ocean all day long and not be bored. Searching for shells and sea glass is a fun bonus experience. You can even rent snorkeling or surfing gear by the day or the stay. We had a big grill on the huge deck that we used almost every day. Our little 22 month old enjoyed the space. We left the doors accessing the deck open most of the time. She absolutely loved being so close to the beach and enjoyed playing with the beach toys provided by Trevor and Jennifer. The beach was so close and so wonderful. There was plenty of snorkeling and beautiful views to see. The reef was plentiful with lots of ocean life that you can get lost in as you follow it through the area. You could walk down the beach to the east and be secluded or walk to the west and visit Villa Montana for some good eats. The sunsets were beautiful and night beach walking was great. I love to take pictures and there was so many shots, I couldn't keep up. We were there during Halloween and Jennifer planned out a trick or treat adventure for all the kids including mine and even let us borrow a little outfit so my girl wouldn't be left out. These people were so family oriented and loved to meet new people and made us feel like a part of their family. We loved this place and the community surrounding this area. Ola Lola is also a place to visit near by with great food and they will welcome you with open arms. The day we left was hard enough leaving the ocean and about one hour after leaving Villa Tropical, I realized I had left my wedding ring in the top drawer of the nightstand, ugh! Trevor and Jennifer mailed it back to us even adding insurance without hesitation and didn't bother to add it to our bill. I would totally recommend Villa Tropical and I love the secluded, homey feeling of this place. It isn't fancy but, it is absolutely wonderful for someone who doesn't need pampering and is looking for the real deal!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, very well run, apartment was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in M3 with our three adult children for my 60th birthday, the apartment was very nice, three bedrooms, three baths, laundry, fabulous ocean views. The place was clean and had everything you need. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “This place was Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: missxandpablo
Reviews.Content: After spending a lovely time on Vieques(although we were broken into there and our stuff was stolen while i was taking a shower in a rental home) we were lucky to spend time at villa tropical.We stayed in an apt on top floor in main bldg and the view was spectacular.easy access down the steps and straight onto the beach.They gave us beach towels to use,no charge!they also tried very hard to get us snorkel equipment even though they were cleaned out from all the rentals using the equipment that weekend.The apt was no frills, but it served its purpose.It has a large deck and is perfect for grilling large picnic table for families and lounge chairs. The beach was fantastic.the blue hole is divine for snorkeling and the owners went out of their way to make us feel at home.they took us on a tour of their other properties which were gorgeous and our plan is to return and rent one of those other locations.Our original plan was to stay there and drive to rincon to get surfing instruction, but we decided to just stay there it was so nice.Supermarket is less than 10 minutes away and there is a fabulous restaurant nearby luna Marina.The new chef there came to our table and we took his recommendations and were extremely happy.Excellent little gem of seafood and nouveau cuisine.Service was a little slow, but the food was worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location/surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Teague73
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Villa Tropical two times. I love it. It is not glamorous or super luxurious BUT it is still amazing. It is located on one of the most beautiful beaches in the Caribbean. The beach is perfect for snorkeling, paddleboarding, kiteboarding, or just relaxing. The sunsets are incredible too. I have never been disappointed. Call Cookie or Trevor. They will make sure that you have a great time. Trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Two times in Two months”
Reviews.Author: MalinA777
Reviews.Content: I had the fantastic opportunity to go both in August and October and both times for 5 nights and had the pleasure to experience Villa Tropical and its hosts. The booking and planning of the trips were flawless and checking in after office hours was no trouble at all â€“ Cookie and Trevor had it all set up and organized for us - so the first night was spent by the ocean. The first time around I stayed in M2 sharing the porch with another couple in M1 (worked out as both couples were there to chill). The August weather was a great experience for snorkelling and water activities and the warm weather and sunshine was well needed. Morning runs on the beach felt safe and the dip in the ocean afterwards â€“ canâ€™t beat that. Second time was in early October where I stayed in M4 â€“ it had been mentioned that it would be too high up and too hot, but neither was true for us â€“ incredible view and with windows and doors open it was tremendously pleasant. Falling asleep to the sound of the ocean, waking up to the sound of the ocean was an amazing experience. Both M2 and M4 was clean, neat, and tidy; the kitchen had the amenities to make breakfast, lunch and dinner no problem â€“ and then it was the â€œcommunityâ€� gas grill that had us enjoy tasty evening meals. The hosts, Trevor and Jennifer were very friendly and were eager to let us know of things and places to go, at the same time having us enjoying a chilled vacation on our own. If I donâ€™t know better â€“ I might come back soon ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “So good, I did it twice!”
Reviews.Author: Hank L
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Villa Montana, just to the west of Villa Tropical some years back, and on the last day noticed the Tropical and thought, "next time I come, I have to check that out." Years later, drained and exhausted, booked a 5 night stay at the last minute. Stayed in M1 and there was a couple in M2, but I always felt that the ocean view and the porch was my own private wonderland. The only thing bad about the trip was that work demands meant that I worked 2/3rds of the time there. Even with that, it was a relaxing, quiet place to focus, and when I wasn't working Trevor and Cookie were great in suggesting things to do, suggesting places to go and most importantly, let me chill. There was no pressure, no conflicts, just cool folks with big smiles, providing very clean and up-to-date accomadations. A few weeks later, I decided to go back to have a real vacation, this time staying in M4, against the going word that it would be too hot up there. Hey, it was worth it! Trevor, Jennifer and Cookie were again both laid back and professional, and the owners of the place were generous with paddleboarding and snorkeling tips. They all felt like the sort of folks you'd want to hang out with, but they let you be to yourself. It's worth the trip, well worth the money and a great place to spend as a couple, with a family, or on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Is this heaven?”
Reviews.Author: giselameister
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place! The owners,Trevor and Jennifer, Rosa (housekeeping), Mike and his wife...everything was perfect. There's is something for every taste..from the rustic to the modern. We were at Villa QuiÃ±ones and share other condos with other 3 couples and everybody loved it. Right on the beach, fully equiped with satelitte cable tv, a/c...BBQ.. sunny days, surfing competition...what else you can ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Belatedly.. A brilliant family holiday!”
Reviews.Author: atotty
Reviews.Content: Our high expecations were fully met. Our clean, spacious, well equipped and very comfortable (M3) villa overlooking the beautiful beach was perfect for our family of four. Whether active with watersports, lazing on the beach or exploring the interior it was ideal and especially lovely for quiet evenings enjoying the stunning sunsets. Trevor and the VT team were wonderful - offering good advice on shopping and eating, loaning watersports gear, or fixing any minor problems. We'll be back. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “A very cool place to relax”
Reviews.Author: diputado99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend at Villa Tropical to celebrate my 50th birthday. The room..actually a studio apartment...was very clean, very well equipped, and very comfortable. We had a huge wooden deck right in front of our apartment, and a great view of the ocean. The beach in front is great for snorkeling, but not that good for swimming, due to the reefs and strong cross-current. Overall, we had no complaints...except for the fact that while we were there they were apparently remodeling some apartments next door, and the guys working on that cranked up a very loud gas-powered generator at 8 am on both Saturday and SUNDAY morning that pretty much drowned out the sounds of the surf and everything else for that matter. But other than that...NO PROBLEMS!!! A great value!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Tyson B
Reviews.Content: It's not for people who are expecting "Hotel type Service; cleaning up the room while you are staying there, amenities, etc. If you are into making your own meals, being in a secluded place then this is perfect for you. The facility is well thought out. Isabela Beach is not a great place to swim but it is beautiful. Aguadilla beach is not too far (Crash Boat) so you can still enjoy a great time at the beach. There was one small incident when one of VT's employees was making visits to each room for maintenance reasons. My spouse and I were surprised by the unexpected visit. I recommended to the owner to next time give a courtesy call before sending some to a room. I recommend to you all to mention this when you visit to minimize the chance of such a surprise. Overall though, this place is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip”
Reviews.Author: alexgon3
Reviews.Content: we were here in july for 3 days in Villa Viento a house with a 2 Bedrooms downstairs and 1 Complete apartment Upstairs Beautiful beach with I literally snokerled all day I saw Nemo Darly and Mr. Crabs lol It was awesome Im definitly planning to go again......

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking view”
Reviews.Author: teacher34
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights here with a friend of mine. I have been to the town of both Isabela and Aguadilla numerous times, and this is the first time I have stayed here. We stayed in Q3 which sleeps two people, and actually could probably sleep three if you are traveling with a child. The view is spectaculor. Our unit was on the second floor with a wonderful large balcony which you share with another unit. There was just a single person staying in that unit, and they went to work every morning, so we barely saw her, and basically had the entire balcony to ourselves. The units are furnished with everything you will need to feel comfortable during your stay. Kookie, the receptionist, was inviting and a wonderful help. As soon as we got there she took us to our unit, showed us what to do, where things were, etc. We actually just wanted to sit on the balcony and enjoy the beach. The actual swimming beach is a few feet away, there you can swim, see coral, and snorkel. You can rent snorkeling equipment. for I belive, $10. For food both Isabella and Aguadilla have grocery stores, and many restuarants, bakeries, eateries, no shoratage. Around the corner when you are on the main street you can grab "pastellilos" which are basically a turnovers, stuffed with shrimp, meat, cheese, etc for $1.25! They are great! You can go further down to Jobos beach and find small bars, and restuarants and get whatever you want. Ocean Front also has a nice open bar where you can get a full meal or appetizers and enjoy the ocean. I want to stress this is not a fancy hotel. This is not your Westin or Four Seasons type of properties. This is more on the condo scenario, and it might seem a bit outdated with the furniture for some people. However, I want to say we couldn't have been happier here. This is absolutely a quiet, pristine, amazing property with views worth a million bucks. I am hoping to return next year with my entire family and rent the larger rooms that sleep six. I was pleasantly surprised. This was like finding a diamond in the rough type of experience. It was delightful!

Reviews.Title: “Thinking of going back on Labor Day Weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: familiarodsan
Reviews.Content: I just got home last tuesday from Villa Tropical and I have to say that me and my family, had a great time. We stayed at Villa Bajandas 1, and were greatly surprised. I am aware that this is not your most requested villa, but I have to say that it had everything we were looking for, especially privacy. My wife, my two sons and I probably will go back for Labor Day Weekend!!! Angel Rodriguez

Reviews.Title: “An awesome stay with a large group!”
Reviews.Author: ashdh122
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 14 that stayed for a week. Awesome Deck, awesome view, very clean, and steps to water. Couldn't have asked for a better location. We rented 4 condo units, all in one villa and all on the ocean view side. The place was a little out dated on the interior, but that doesn't really matter when you are spending most of your time out on the great deck and beautiful waters!! This is a place we will definately come back to. We tried the horse back riding just up the road, and its a definate must! Great views and the people are very nice. over all our trip to PR in general was a great trip, our stay was great and our big group was happy!! Villa tropical was perfect for our family!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Weekend”
Reviews.Author: JosueFlores
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed there last weekend and as a vivid traveler, RCI/Time Share traveler/ world explorer I can assure you that this property took my entire attention the minute I stepped in the deck. First the small office was packed with great â€œone on oneâ€� attention and the receptionist walked with us to the shack and even showed us around. After a few steps there we were; enjoying our weekend in less than 10 minutes in a very relaxed and beautiful place. The apartments are fully furbish, all we had to bring was our food because everything else is available; even the gas for the outdoor grill that we used all the time. We ran out of gas but with a simple call to the management our grill was running again in 5 minutes. If what you are looking for is a crowded, loud beach full of people and other issues then this is not the place for you but if you are looking for a piece of paradise to relax; and I mean relax and enjoy mother nature in a very well groomed place then Villa Tropical is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Tropical on July 2011”
Reviews.Author: Fishermen07
Reviews.Content: We went down to PR and stayed at Villa Tropical from July 2nd-9th. The staff is very friendly and the location is beatiful. We were 6 amigos and stayed at the rental units R1 and R2. There were a few setbacks on our stay. It was never said that If rains, the decks above theese two units are not sealed, and you will get wet. Also the stoves/ovens on these two rentals need replacement. They are old. The same goes to the grills that are in the deck. They need desperatly to be replaced. Unit R1 was infested with big roaches. I understand the place is rustic but there has to be a limit on what is acceptable. One more thing on Unit R1 there were low or none water pressuer in the shower. If all these comments are addresed and fixed I would be back in a second. But if they are not this place is not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to return!!!”
Reviews.Author: offtothebeach70
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from the July 4th weekend where we spent 4 nights at the Villa Tropical. It was a perfect informal getaway. No shirt, no shoes, no problem. The overall experience at Villa Tropical is very casual and perfect for those wanting to be "left alone". Trevor, the property manager could not have been more accommodating. The one bedroom apartment (M1) we rented was located directly on the beach. The beach is a little rocky, but has fantastic snorkeling in swallow waters. The water was amazing. We found some great "very casual" places to eat near Villa Tropical. Every morning I would wake up and get coffee as well as freshly made meat/seafood pastelitos (pastries) from a stand right around the corner. Also make sure to check out Sonia Rican on Jobos and the newly opened Cafe Aroma near the airport in Aguadilla. We especially liked Cafe Aroma for the fabulous cappuccinos and delicious homemade deserts. Cafe Aroma was a daily ritual for us. Overall, we had a fantastic time. We are ready to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Secluded Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ladybythelake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the M2 unit at Villa Tropical over the July holiday. The view was beautiful, the beach uncrowded, and the snorkeling wonderful. We would definitely stay here again if we ever return to Northwest Puerto Rico. It's close to the airport, so you will get some noise from planes taking off, usually in the afternoons or at night. There are a few things that could really improve this unit - replace the bed, and small rugs placed around the unit. The small rugs were very dirty, I actually washed them while we were there, and that helped a lot. The bed was very uncomfortable with the vinyl mattress cover on it, it made it very hot when sleeping, for us. BUT, even with that we enjoyed our stay and would come again, but probably stay in a different unit.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Scullyster
Reviews.Content: Villa Tropical is a series of apartments on Shacks Beach in the northwest corner of Puerto Rico. Our apartment had a huge porch overlooking the ocean, providing the perfect place from which to enjoy the spectacular sunsets and sunrises. Shacks beach is uncrowded, and you can walk for miles in either direction and get to other beaches. The snorkeling at Shacks Beach was good; the water as clear as glass. There is a rock ledge that makes access from the beach into the water somewhat difficult - especially wearing snorkeling fins. Villa Tropical's location is the best of two worlds. It feels isolated, but is conveniently located next to a first class restaurant, Eclipse, and within walking distance of a sandwich shop with a tropical flair, Ola Lola's. It is within easy driving distance of restaurants, bakeries and a supermarket, as well as the Rafael Hernandez Airport (which also makes for early morning noise as the planes depart). If you have a car, it's also not far from the mountains. We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 night stay and wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, peaceful property”
Reviews.Author: powderdaysinjax
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend at Villa Tropical. It's a fantastic hotel, which features apartments with full kitchens. It's run by a very friendly, helpful Canadian family. We rented a 1BR beach-front condo with a covered patio (with hammock). Beautiful, quiet location. On Shacks Beach, walking distance to Jobos and Survival Beaches- short drive to other beaches, restaurants (110 Thai is awesome) and a grocery store. Fully stocked with kitchen utensils and there is a grill you can use too. Very close to Aguadilla airport (10 min) 2 1/2 hour drive to San Juan airport (depending on traffic). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded Tropical Paradise for the family”
Reviews.Author: lorielovespuertorico
Reviews.Content: The villa we stayed was excellent and very reasonably priced. Our villa was a two story villa. My sister and her family stayed in the upstairs villa and my family stayed in the downstairs villa. Each villa was fully equipped with 2 bedrooms, one bath, kitchen, dinning room, and living room. We were just yards away from the beach. It felt like a private beach. We are all very satisfied with the location, the beautiful beach and awesome postcard ocean. Can't wait for next family vacation there.

Reviews.Title: “MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACE IN THE WORLD”
Reviews.Author: kayaktheworld
Reviews.Content: Villa Tropical is WONDERFUL! We stayed in "TR" (Top Right), a two bedroom with a shared balcony overlooking the reef at Shacks Beach. It's a small reef teeming with fish; we saw many kinds of fish, two barracuda, and out in the Blue Hole (a deeper area of the reef accessible at low tide) a young loggerhead sea turtle! Trevor is friendly and awesome, the town is extremely chill, there's an Econo (grocery store similar to US layout, decent prices) only a few miles away, a great bar a few miles away called Sonida del Mar (cheap pina coladas and DELICIOUS empanadillas). We woke up every morning and walked down the stairs to the beach to snorkel first thing, grilled breakfast out on the deck overlooking palm trees and the beach and watched brewer's blackbirds and lizards run around, hung out at local bars and went swimming again! Hot water occasionally a bit spotty, broom to sweep out your own sand, beach front access from the back porch, surprisingly strong window unit air conditioners, huge deck umbrellas if you feel like grilling out in the rainy season afternoon storms (which we did, and was great!) We explored a bit by car and checked out other beaches, and came to the conclusion there was really no reason to ever leave Shacks beach, right off our own deck. Fabulous experience!

Reviews.Title: “Service, location, delightful”
Reviews.Author: Globe_galloper_11
Reviews.Content: Wow... what a relief to find a place exactly how I like it: on the beach without the crowds, clean and comfortable rooms, well-outfitted kitchen, wi-fi, huge deck with grill overlooking excellent snorkeling / shore diving. Refreshing and relaxing place with delightful, thorough, thoughtful service - helpful without being intrusive. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to say”
Reviews.Author: majch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at M4 for 4 nights and it was awesome. Penthouse, spacious 1 bedroom with the beach spitting distance away and a great deck. The kitchen has everything for cooking and storing food and there's also a grill that is shared with everyone. The only negative was that the waves kept us up at night (sarcasm). The unit was extremely clean and bug free which is not always easy in the Carib. The main guy we dealt with was Trevor and as an american, he was very cognizant of what makes a hotel / condo successful. We also stayed at Q2 which is a ground floor room. It had a hammock but wasn't as updated as M4.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ejejr
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to Villa Tropical for 6 consecutive years now...every time is a great experience. Trevor, Cookie, and all of the staff always make us feel at home. We've stayed at multiple residents at Villa Tropical. The luxury of each may differ, but the quality does not waver. The fact that we have satellite TV is great, but I usually tell my kids that it's not working (even though it always does). The real "big screen picture" is the view of the crashing waves from our deck or the star lit sky at night. The kids never even ask for the TV (I watch the news after they're asleep). This is a perfect place to bring your family to re-connect and remember what is really important in your life. I love being able to barbecue on the deck while watching my kids play on the beach, a few yards away. If you're looking for a mint on your pillow every morning, go to the Ritz Carlton...If you want some good down to Earth family fun, to be comfortable, to walk out of your back door and on to the beach every morning.....I highly recommend Villa Tropical

Reviews.Title: “HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: chupakilldevilhills
Reviews.Content: Thanks Trevor and Staff for yet another fantastic vacation. This was our 7th year in a row and we have booked again for next year. The people we meet are great and Trevor and his Staff are very accomodating, helpful, and friendly. They are always working to keep the V.T. the beautiful place that it is. In our opinion it has the most beautiful sunsets and beaches around. There is nothing better than rum drinks, sunsets,with new and old friends on the deck . Surfing ,picking up seaglass and seashells everyday is the best way in the world to relax. It has the most beautiful swimming spot(blue hole) that i have ever seen. Make sure you bring you camera. I can only imagine what it would be like to dive in the blue hole. I come here for the surf and my wife for the glass and shells. We always feel safe and very welcomed when we are there. We could not ask for a better vacation. While visiting make sure you get a sandwhich from Sandwich Delight and visit John and Elaine at Ola Lolas for a cold one. See ya next year. Mucho Gracias, Kevin & C Lou. and keep up the great work guys and gals.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: burgytownie
Reviews.Content: we stayed in BL for 4 nights with our 14 month daughter. clean and comfortable and perfect configuration for our needs. literally 20 steps to the beach, a great deck, beautiful views! not fancy, but very casual and homey. staff was friendly, other guests were fun to meet. if you're looking for lots of privacy, don't choose this unit or the studio next to it, as the deck is shared space and also the main entry point to the beach for other guests. not a problem for us, we liked the community feel, and it wasn't like 100 people were coming by daily (maybe 15 max). there are other units available if you're looking for more privacy. we're already thinking about next year's visit!

Reviews.Title: “Best place on the northwest corner hands down”
Reviews.Author: hobieguy
Reviews.Content: Villa Tropical is by far the nicest place and the nicest setting that I have encountered in 35 years of staying near the West Coast of Puerto Rico. I am a Fifty four year old surfer, sailer, and free diver and believe me Villa Tropical has it all right in front of your room. I even watched whales while eating snacks on the patio. The owners live in one of the nearby oceanfront houses and constantly make sure the premises are super clean, and sandfree past the beach. The room was great, the bathroom has good hot water supply, the staff are knowledgeable and friendly. You never hear loud music, bugs are rare, and the other vacationers are professionals and curtious. I will stay here again and again. This is one of the rare places that even my wife would stay at!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well worn furnature and needs upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Photo-2_Vermont
Reviews.Content: These are private apartments that are rented by the Villa Tropical management. I feel that some apartments (separate buildings) are outstanding and some are there to generate income. The one we rented this time had and outstanding on-the-beach location but the furniture was uncomfortable and well worn as were the beds. The linens were in short supply but the place was very clean. The bedroom air conditioners were all extremely nosily and needed upgrading (had to shut them down to get some sleep). The main room air conditioner remote control needed a fine touch to operate - needs replacing badly. Main room ceiling fan was so out of balance that you could not use it. Obviously the owner does not want to put any money into the place. The grounds were perfectly manicured although you need a small car to fit into the parking spaces and still get out of the car doors. The outstanding location made the stay worth recommending to a friend with warnings about the condition of the furniture, beds and appliances.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Beach, Ocean, Coral, Snorkelling..."Blue Hole"”
Reviews.Author: Karena_11
Reviews.Content: We walked along the beach a few miles East to Jobo, and we took the Tropical Trailrides West on the Beach...Fantastic. The apartment we stayed in had everything we wanted, great kitchen, bathroom very nice too. Amazing Deck. Kids are 14 and 8. They loved it, played in sand and collected shells. And they learned how to snorkel...the water was a little rough though.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views and a laid-back, care-free place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: authordesigner
Reviews.Content: I spent lots and lots of time on tripadvisor and calling various inns and hotels and b and b's in Puerto Rico, as we had never been there. When I spoke with Trevor on the phone, I knew that I had found the right place. We spent a few days in Old San Juan and hiking in El Yunque and then drove two hours to Isabela. We had planned to go to other places in PR but ended up staying the entire time at Villa Tropical as it was just perfect for us. Our room was clean and functional with a great little grill on the deck. The deck overlooked the beach which is one of the most beautiful ones that I have ever seen. It can be windy and rugged or calm and serene and offers sports and activities for either condition. Trevor can guide you to places to eat or towards various activities, like scuba diving, in the area. We enjoyed several evenings at Ola Lola's down the road and even bought fresh fish off the boats at a nearby beach for grilling. We went diving with a dive master friend of Trevor's who was an excellent guide. We dislike large resorts or hotels where everything you do costs extra. Villa Tropical offered us options.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely vacation spot without the usual touristy stuff”
Reviews.Author: JSmith0929
Reviews.Content: This place is simply lovely. The management is fantastic, the beach is beautiful and the lack of the typical beach activities (jet ski, parasailing, etc.) is refreshing. This is a very romantic place where real families live, so not the place to go to have late parties, but a lovely place to sit back, relax and trust that you will not be disturbed by obnoxious guests.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: jjjsfish
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here.We stayed in R1 and loved it. the view was amazing. The accommodations were very nice.Not fancy,but clean and serviceable. Great place to stay and see the area. The manager Trevor was great and recommended some great activities and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect resort/rental balance.”
Reviews.Author: back2interstate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really don't like big resorts, which is a lot of the reason we love Villa Tropical. Big resorts feel like tourist factories too much of the time. Villa Tropical strikes the perfect balance between a rental property (where you're on your own and are never sure of what you're getting) and a small resort. The managers/owners were lovely, and everyone was very helpful...but only when we needed them. The rest of the time we felt we had escaped to our own private getaway. I originally dismissed Villa Tropical due to some negative reviews (that were either older, or about the less desirable units). We ended up staying in M3 and found it to be in great condition, with everything we needed. The biggest appeal is the area, which was perfect for walking the beach and snorkeling right in front of the property. Diving and good dining options were right nearby. A lot of people were surfing right out front as well. If you're looking for a quite, relaxing, laid-back getaway that's on a great beach, this is one fantastic option.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Kittyskatz
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note for those who want to travel alone & have always been afraid. This is the place to go. I was made to feel like a family member by the owners...Trevor & Jennifer....They even made sure I was given a ride to the local grocery, as I didn't rent a car & it would have been a long walk. I felt very safe alone at night, walking the beach & going to the local bar for a beer. Villa Tropical would be my choice with or without other travelers. Every morning I awoke to a breath taking view of the ocean from my front door. It was less than a 2 minute walk to a clean beach over looking the "Blue Hole" where I spent 6 days enjoying the sun & sand & the peace of mind I was looking forward to. Special thanks to Vincent......maintance/gardner.....he became a close friend that made my stay even more special.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, beautiful views, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: whippetlovers
Reviews.Content: Isabela, Puerto Rico is BEAUTIFUL! My fiancÃ©` and I stayed in a room by ourselves at Villa Tropical with a large group for a wedding. Some people shared rooms in large or small groups like 4 or 6. Villa Tropical was great for a big wedding party b/c it is close t everything so its easy to meet up with people if you split up to do your own thing. The rooms were clean, the furniture was like beach furniture, great lighting, tall ceilings, hammock on our patio, and outside seating. Comfy couches, tile floors, fast working AC units, stove, oven, fridge, cups, plates, utensils, blenders, etc. We were 10 feet or so from the beach. The view was amazing- long walks with beautiful scenes. We went to a total of 5 beaches; all beaches had beautiful and unique scenery- all different. Hobo beach had the best view. All beaches were within 10 minutes from Villa Tropical. If you are interested in surfing, water sports, water gear, scuba, etc, there are 3-4 places close by to rent equipment or purchase supplies or lessons. There is also a grocery store nearby where we purchased enough to make b-fast, eat snacks, and have light lunches, but we ate out for all of our dinners and some lunches because the food in Isabela, PR is AMAZING. The owner of Villa Tropical was very helpful; he gave us tips as far as where to go- definitely utilize the owners â€“ there are a few â€“ mike and trevor- each of them own different villas that are all together in the same â€œneighborhoodâ€�. Although the AC in the bedroom was awesome and the queen bed was big, my only complaint is that the bed was not very comfortable. That's why sleep quality gets 4 stars. After a day at the beach, i just passed out anyway, so it was not that big of a deal. The people are very friendly in Isabela, PR. Itâ€™s the only city on the island that has no court room and thatâ€™s b/c there is very little crime, something like 1 crime last year! Our car rental place told us that. ï�Š It definitely felt safe. Itâ€™s a surf town, so very chill. The internet was good; only went down once in 5 days, and that was for like 10 minutes. Sometimes we had to walk outside on our patio to get service with our phone or laptop, but it was not a nuisance or anything. Isabela, PR was one of the best vacations I have ever been on. Villa Tropical was comfortable, lots to do nearby, various beaches to choose from that are close, great food nearby, close to everything you need, relaxing rooms, great views, friendly staff, helpful. If I go to Isabela, PR again I would definitely stay at Villa Tropical. Please feel free to contact me with any questions!

Reviews.Title: “More then we expected”
Reviews.Author: ArubaLover55
Reviews.Content: We were going to Puerto Rico for some R& R over the holiday. Some friends (who live in P.R.) recommended Villa Tropical, saying that the apartments were oceanside- "right on the beach", wonderful owners and a great location! We found this all to be true and then some!! Loved sitting on our deck overlooking the ocean in the a.m. with our coffee, and then sitting there again late at night listening to the waves! Very relaxing. Had fun watching the surfers & "kite/board" surfers and going snorkling right outside our door. The apartment was in excellent shape (building "Q"), and had everything we needed to cook our own meals. The grounds were in great shape too. An added note: it is just a short walk to a fantastic "little" bar - Ola Lola's - great food, drink & owners. We will return to Villa Tropical! Would recommend this place for couples as well as families.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: winendiningduo
Reviews.Content: We had struggled through 7 days of rain and heat and humidity with no air conditioning staying at a friends place outside Rincon and we needed relief when we ran into the owner of the Villa Tropical on a boat trip- and it was the answer to our prayers. The location outside of Isabela was perfect for us - it has one pf the best snorkeling beaches in Puerto Rico and very close to the airport. We arrived at the apratment and saw the view from the spacious deck and just loved it. The accomodations were clean and neat, with all the essentials, air conditioning, full kitchen, great TV and wi-fi - and they even have back-up generators for when the electric goes out ( which it did!)- and the price was reasonable for an oceanfront apartment. The snorkeling from the beach is amazing and so convenient - just walk off the deck and you are on a picturesque sandy beach. I wished we had stayed here for our entire vacaction and not just the last 3 days. There is also a great little eatery called Ola Lola's that is within walking distance and had the best pina coladas and burgers and the owners are very friendly and welcoming. The Villa Tropical has an ideal location - the airport is less than 10 minutes away and it is easy access to the highway to get to other places on the island. I would definitely return and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: huibraddah
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Unit M3. Beautiful area, ideal location. Windsurfing wasn't what I had hoped, but will bring kiting gear next time. Trevor is a very cool host and looks after all your needs. Snorkeling is world class right out your door. Neighbors of VT are very friendly and hospitable. Ola Lola's (walking distance) is an awesome makeshift bar/restaurant where guests and locals can mingle casually and sip refreshing cocktails or eat a great meal. Tropical Trail Rides- walking distance is an incredible riding experience on pristine beach and almond forest. This place is the "GEM" of Puerto Rico" for those who aren't the "resort" types. We hate resorts. This place is for laid-back, adventurous, easy-going people into being mellow and not requiring pampering. Our 3 bdmr unit was great, except that the kitchen could be better equipped for those of us with culinary inclinations. Even just some stemware for wine/cocktails and a few sharp knives would go a LONG way. That said..i'd go back in an instant. In fact, like the Terminator, we WILL be back! Gracias to Trevor for being such a great host and all around cool dude. Peace

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful unit at great location”
Reviews.Author: Fl_travelergville
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Q3, a newer building which is exactly as portrayed in the pictures. The furnishings were very pleasant and the kitchen was well equipped. The balcony was terrific, although we did not realize it was shared with the unit next door. Really not problematic as it is so large and well set up that you could maintain your own space. Two air conditioners (one in bedroom) keep the unit very comfortable in the heat of the day. Nice outside areas adjacent to the building, all part of the Villa Tropical, that included picnic tables, BBQ grill, showers, and comfortable lawn furniture. Great, fairly secluded, beach that you can walk for miles on in either direction. Husband was able to get wireless service, important to him. Ate a short distance down the beach one night at Eclipse at Villa Montana. It was spendy and the service was slow, but the view was spectacular and the food great. Spent a fun evening at Ola Lola (walkable from VT) down the road, a simple bar with delicious food run by very sociable couple, John and Elaine. They were very knowledgeable about the area and made local recommendations for sights and places to go. Does appear to be a good deal of variability between individual units, so just research which unit you are reserving and be aware that they are not all the same. The reservation process was smooth and we arrived at dusk and had no trouble locating our keys. Would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Session is not up to the normal standards when compared to the other properties.”
Reviews.Author: ClubSB
Reviews.Content: Villa Tropical came highly recommended. The location is perfect, right on Shacks Beach. Some of our party had stayed here before. Just not in this unit. All other units were booked and from the website and talking to the owner/mgr of Villa Tropical we decided to stay at Casa Session. However, this unit is substandard. Casa Session should be either removed from the property management listing or the staff needs to get real about what Casa Session really is.... and it is NOT as described on the website or by Trevor. When we arrived, we were shocked. There were Big Wheels and two barking dogs in the compound. And it does look like a compound. We could not open the gate without fear of a dog bite. Cujo and his buddy were in attack mode. The unit was nothing like we expected. Cookie, a wonderful lady, offered us another unit for one night while they had the Cujo family move to another location. The ocean front unit called Villa Sol is wonderful. As is Villa Quinones where another couple from our group stayed. After seeing the cramped accommodation of Villa Session, two of our friends elected to go to Villa Montana Beach Resort, which is not part of Villa Tropical, but just a short walk down the beach. The rest of us stayed and paid our penance. Casa Session, the upstairs unit is a hot, stuffy box with a sliver of an ocean view. There is no air in the central living/kitchen area. Even closing all the windows and creating a dark-hot-box while trying to blow A/C from the bedrooms only brought the temperature down to 86 degrees. Not conducive to cooking or relaxing. The patio has a view of barbed-wire, and one sliver of ocean can be seen. The patio is no relief from the heat inside, as it has not much in the way of airflow or light. This unit would make a great surfer crash pad, and only if the rates were cut in half. If you just got out of prison, you'd feel right at home in this unit. The outside bathroom is reminiscent of the movie Cool Hand Luke and the scenes with the box. Only use this bathroom in the early morning. During the day, you risk your life. Night, brings in the creatures. From website: Casa Session is the latest built building managed by Villa Tropical. It is crisp and new inside with fresh paint and new furniture and artwork. Well manicured (NOT) with new furniture (NOT) and paint, (Okay, the paint was fresh; from a can and on the rusty patio furniture. We had green paint on our arms.) Casa Session is only 30 (Try 84 paces..) paces south of the beach. Exceptional privacy, private decks, yard, parking, laundry and barbecue. There is a three bedroom upstairs which has ocean-view from the deck, and a two-bedroom on the main level. (You call that a deck? Now, where is the ocean? Oh, past the barbed-wire.) There are laundry facilities in the base of the building and private parking. (Washer/Dryer/Barbecue are all located on the side of the building. Outside. Rusty.) deck does have ocean views and great patio furniture (Great?) with rocker. There are queen-size beds in two of the bedrooms and a full-size in the third. A/C in each bedroom and lots of closet space. Full kitchen and comfy TV lounge area. (Comfy? With all the window closed? A dark sweat box) --

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Wanted to stay longer.”
Reviews.Author: JimmyFatToe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in R2, while my daugher and her boyfriend stayed in R1. The rooms are adjacent. This place isn't elegant, but the units are clean, and the beach is right out the door. We spent our time on the decks or on the beach, so who needs a fancy room? The beach is terrific. It's uncrowded, and it goes for miles. Great snorkeling right in front of the place. There are restaurants and stores nearby, and the neighborhood is quiet. Both units are equipped with gas grills, satellite TV, and adequate kitchens. The knives in the kitchens are very dull, however. My wife didn't like the place as well as I did, as she likes her vacations to be a little more posh, but we all had fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Gusto2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights mid week early March and loved it. Value for money was excellent. Rooms are right on the ocean so can go for long walks on the beach out of your back door. Snorkelling is excellent with several blue holes in front of the villa (ask Trevor how to find them underwater). Surfing is close-by on Hobos beach. We bought food and alcohol in San Juan, incl fresh fish, and grilled fish and veg on the gas grill every night to the sound of waves crashing on the beach. We walked along the beach to the west & had drinks at the outdoor bar at the Villa next door (great pina coladas & mojitos). This is ideal for people who want a low-key beach vacation with local color and away from major tourist resports

Reviews.Title: “Very nice- wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: bebops87018
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a room/apartment here for one night- we stayed in Q5 which is called ocean view but really ocean peek (you can see the ocean but it's really an obscured view as this building is behind another). Doesn't matter much- great value for the price. If the future I would stay longer and get a full ocean front space- they looked very nice! And the added benefit of having a kitchen, refrigerator, microwave, toaster, etc is a great benefit for longer stays. Wish we had been there longer and had been able to take advantage of it. The place we had was very clean, had free wifi, a large patio, and the bathroom was very nice- towels (plenty of them and soft) and bedding all smelled clean and fabric softener fresh- even the comforter. They had beach towels available to use and other equipment was free to use. Beach was nice- lots of snorkeling and shallow areas as well as surfing areas- also not at all crowded on the beach- lots of space to walk and enjoy the area. Very detailed guide of things to do in the area, dining, and pretty much anything you might want to know written by the owner- but it's dated 2006 and seems like it could use some updating- we tried to find on restaurant that I think may no longer exist- but found plenty of other options within a short drive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Managment, Great time in PR”
Reviews.Author: OCNJ_surf_photos
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great location in PR for a surf trip, this is it. It is only 10 minutes from Aguadilla airport. The ocean front units were booked, but we were only about 50 steps from the beach with a nice view (who sits inside anyway!). Shacks is right in front of Villa Tropical for a convenient an end of day surf session, there is snorkeling, diving and beach. Forget your mask and snorkel, or want a softboard for a grom traveling with you, you can get them right at VT. Only about 5 minutes from Hang Loose Surf shop (great folks, with lessons if you need them!) While we were there they put in a new ocean front gas grill in case you don't want to eat out at any of local spots. 8 minutes from Playa Jobos (definitely hit Juniors Pizza) 15 minutes from Middles, 45 minutes (depending on traffic) from Rincon, about 10 minutes from surfers beach. Scuba shop about 8 miles Grocery store in Isabela is about 20 minutes away. If you are going to shoot pics of surfing, 400 mm lens is the minimum and you certainly would not be sorry if you bring a 500 or 600mm lens. But bring your wide angle and 18-105 zoom for the many other things you will want to remember. If you want to find anything, VT left about 20 pages of things to do and places to go in the room, so if you want to go visit San Sebastien Waterfall... (by the way go!) don't worry the directions are right in the room! Anything you don't know, ask Trevor he does! One final note, these are condo's if you are looking to be waited on in a 5-star hotel this is not your spot, I saw one review that panned VT as being OK for surfers... I think they missed the mark, I plan on going back with the whole family and not just the surf crowd next time...

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable view.”
Reviews.Author: gepipe
Reviews.Content: Easy to get too from airport. Very relaxing place. The view is worth every dollar it is just great. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wake to the sound of the waves on a tropical isle”
Reviews.Author: adventguy
Reviews.Content: Nice facilities right at the beach. Apaarently they have a full range of accomidations. We enjoyed sitting on the deck watching the waves at breakfast. The beach right in front of our room is unspoiled and the water clear and warm. Not sure where it gets better than this. Friendly folks family run

Reviews.Title: “Slum Apartment-- Great View”
Reviews.Author: travelnut3000
Reviews.Content: If you are a 25 year old surfer, you might put up with this nightmare, but we did not find it amusing in any way. We went for a wedding at a friend's house nearby, and luckily we could escape the squalor of our digs most of the time! We arrived at around 7:00 PM and luckily ran into the employee as she was closing up. She directed us to 'look for our keys under the shell' and was off........ Even knowing that we were supposed to be looking for a shell, we had trouble locating it....... can't imagine what we would have done it we hadn't run into the employee.... We got to our apartment in the Villa Bajandas to find an empty beer bottle and a broom on the plastic table on the terrace, and my heart sank. Yes, the view is beautiful, but the tile was filthy and the chairs were all piled up and stuck in a corner-- not very inviting. The interior is, to say the least, basic. There was no working light in the 'master bedroom' so we had to feel around to put our things away in the broken down closet. The tiny bathroom has a leaky toilet, but at least there were clean towels and clean sheets on all of the beds. The A/C works, and there are working fans for the living room. The next morning we went to the office to complain and ask to be moved. Unluckily for us, the were all booked (mostly with friends and family of the wedding party) so we were unable to move. The manager did come up and get one light working in our room as well as mop down the terrace. When we asked what we were supposed to use as beach towels (the whole idea of the place, after all...) he told us that they were all out, but I could purchase some at the front desk. Unbelievable. He brought up one towel a bit later as a 'complimentary gift' which we, of course, left. Other friends had similar experiences, including no toilet paper in the bathroom!!!! (and there are no other paper products throughout the apartments..) On a better note, one group had a very nice apartment that was a three bedroom that was decorated quite well and had a nice clean terrace with actual furniture on it. If you want to stay here, ask for the nice three bedroom. I don't know the name. Their place was like a palace compared to the rest.....

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TurpentineMontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Tropical for one week at the end of February. We were a large group (6 adults and 2 toddlers), so we rented one of the three-bedroom condos. There is a full kitchen, all equipped, which was great for money saving! We pretty much cooked all the time since all necessary shops are about 10 minutes (you have to try the fish hangar at Playa Crash Boat, a 15-20 minute drive, where we bought a tuna for $10 and made 7 big steaks out of it!!!). There was a large terrace overlooking the beach, and it's direct beach access with outside showers and lots of free gear you can borrow. By walking on the beach, you very quickly discover you're the only one around, it's quite deserted! Beware however that the during the week we were there, the beach itself was not really swimmable (though we did quite a bit of snorkelling): quite wavy and windy, which explains the popularity of surf kiting there. However, there is a superb beach a 5-minute drive away, well protected from wind and currents (in front of Villas del Mar Hau, which looked pretty run down from the outside, in case you are considering that option). The hosts were very helpful and friendly, the apartment very clean, large rooms with even a jacuzzi, a real pleasure. Will definitely go back there in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Saved us and then created a wonderful vacation for us!”
Reviews.Author: LindaSpokane_WA
Reviews.Content: Because we were unable to stay beacuse of my allergies to molds in the place we had booked across the street...(don't stay at the Villa Argentina!)...we were left in the late evening with no place to stay. We were saved by wonderful neighbors who recommended Jennifer and Trevor and the Villa Tropical across the street. This is a residential looking area so most all of the places are duplexes or multiple family dwellings, some owner occupied and some rentals. Jennifer and Trevor own the home unit of the Villa Tropical but serve as rental agents for several of the others. They took us in, put us up in one of their units which was available that night and then helped us to find another unit suitable for us. All the units we saw were wonderful...clean, well appointed and on the beach. We did move twice given we had no reservations and they were filling us in where they had room. They went out of their way for us in so many ways. We are most grateful. The place itself is on a spectacular beach with amazing snorkeling right out front and the constant entertainment of kite surfers. It is a remote area with a strong sense of community and respect for others privacy as well. We met some wonderful people and had a great time...especially given it had a rocky start. Thanks again the Jennifer and Trevor. They do a wonderful job.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back to Villa Tropical!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravlinStarre
Reviews.Content: My husband, cousin and myself just stayed at Villa Tropical from the week of Feb 20 - Feb 28th, we arrived late in the evening, so it was very dark when getting to Villa Tropical, when we awoke we couldn't believe the view from our deck, it was absolutely beautiful! Our room was very neat & clean (we were in Villa Tropical TL) the bathroom had been recently updated & our bed was very comfortable. The water was spectacular, it was warm & there was great snorlking. Lots to see as you're sitting under a palm tree watching the 'kite surfers or wind surfers'...... It is def. a 'no frills' beach house, but it is welcoming & has everything you need for a 'laid back' vacation. There is pretty much everything you could need or want right in town, a few grocery stores, local restaurants, etc. And, of course your visit would not be complete without a night or two at "Ohla Lola's", which is in walking distance, it's a quaint little pub with great appetizers & drinks with a staff that couldn't treat you any better if you were family.....John & Elaine are just wonderful!!! We loved it so much we already booked next year, can't wait to get back to see our new friends Trevor & Jennifer (owners) who were just awesome hosts!!! Good luck with the new little one.....SEE YOU ON THE BEACH!!! The Starre Family - CT.......

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views and Service - As usual”
Reviews.Author: mislp
Reviews.Content: We stayed this year in the R2 apartment for two weeks with fantastic views of the ocean, sunrises and sunsets. (This is our fourth stay at Villa Tropical) Wonderful direct acces to the beach with showers available for those of us who scuba/snorkle -to wash off our gear. Comfortable no-nonsense accomadations for four of us. The apartment has a "homey" feel to it for those who have adolescent boys runing in and out. Small kitchen was well equipped and perfect for our needs. If we did find that we needed something - We would just ask the owners and we would have it no time. Appreciate the apartment concept - Don't have Villa Tropical staff in and out of the apartment daily making beds, etc. Had total privacy for our stay with the exception of the one cleaning /linen change at the one week mark. Kudos to the Villa Tropical Staff who worked endlessly on Chrismas Day to see to the needs of their tenants when electricity was on and off as a tropical depression (rare for this time of year) hit the island. They made the experience seem uneventful and were professional through the entire event. They even did it with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, NIce Apartment”
Reviews.Author: COtraveller69
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving here and had a great time. Really low key and relaxing while completely sufficient at the same time. Trevor and his wife took care of any need that came up. The recommendations on their website are right on. Isabella had a lot of great beaches. Hope we can do it again, someday!

Reviews.Title: “Gas grill bottle blew up almost setting house and guest on fire”
Reviews.Author: PRLOVERBostom
Reviews.Content: The management is clueless and after having the gas grill bottle ignite throwing a 10 ft flame and sending us into a panic & nearly burning the place down, I can conclude fairly unsafe. I understand they have there regular clientele of surfers, ect but I cant understand why anyone would come back with so many options in the area.
